lines.content: System.out.println("Hello! I'm Nala the Annoying Cat!\n" + "What can I do for you?\nProtip: Type !help for a list of commands!");
System.out.println("For event and deadline, please type dates and time in the dd/mm/yyyy HHmm (24 hr) format :) (e.g. 31/12/2022 2359)");
"event [description] /at [start date and time, dd/mm/yyyy HHmm] to [end date and time, dd/mm/yyyy HHmm] - create an event\n"+
"deadline [description] /by [date and time, dd/mm/yyyy HHmm] - create a deadline\n"+
"snooze [index] for [duration][metric time] - snooze a deadline. e.g. snooze 5 for 2 hours\n"+
"unmark [index] - mark a task as not done\n"+
"list - shows the current list of tasks\n"+
"find [keyword] - finds tasks in the list that contains keyword\n"+
"print - saves the tasklist to a .txt file\n"+
"bye or end - say goodbye to Nala :(");
* Nala is a class, and at the same time, a cat. Click the link to find out more about her (not malware).{@link ...}
System.out.println("Nala hisses at you (there is an error in your text). Try typing that again (with the correct syntax :))");
System.out.println("Meow :\\ There's an error in your text. Could you repeat that again (with the correct syntax)?");
System.out.println("Meow! I spotted an \"/at\" in your input. Did you mean to create an event? Please create the task again!");
System.out.println("Meow! I spotted an \"/by\" in your input. Did you mean to create an deadline? Please create the task again!");
System.out.println("Meow! I can't create an Event for you without an \"/at\". Please create the task again!");
System.out.println("Meow! I can't create an Deadline for you without a \"/by\". Please create the task again!");
System.out.println("Meow! I can't create an Event for you without a description! Please create the task again!");
System.out.println("Meow! I can't create an Deadline for you without a description! Please create the task again!");
System.out.println("Meow! I can't create an Todo for you without a description! Please create the task again!");
System.out.println("Meow! You did not specify a date. Please create the task again!");
* The Parser class tokenises the user input and stores them into an ArrayList, remainingTokens.
* The tokens will then be parsed sequentially in Duke Main, calling methods in Parser such as parseAddTask() and parseDelete().
* The program then executes these tasks based on the information given from remainingTokens.
* E.g. "Snooze 3 for 5 mins" postpones the duration of task 3 by 5 minutes if and only if it is a Deadline class.

* The TaskList class contains an ArrayList of Tasks, TaskList.
* The TaskList is private and hence cannot be modified unless accessed by a method such as addNewTask() and deleteTask().
* The class also has methods for displaying the task list, displaying a filtered task list, snoozing a task and marking a task as done or not done.
//Consists of operations involving the modification of the task list
//Performs add/remove task operations for all task types.
